They also happened to be having a 'Random act of kindness' donation/discount deal while we were there, for awareness of Human trafficking and gave $5 off of our $20 order, which was great, so we actually researched it a little more and donated $10 to a local Human trafficking organization, so kudos to them on their goal to bring awareness.  They succeeded here, and we'll be back for more coffee and waffles!

This place is so sweet! It's located in the bottom floor of a townhouse, so not easily found, but totally worth the drive once you get there. No need to bother with fruit or toppings for your waffles, although everything is fresh and delicious. The waffles themselves have the pearl sugar in the dough so they are sweet and tasty on their own. The staff is friendly if only a tad inexperienced and first timers tend to need a bit of navigation on the straightforward menu(its almost confusing since there are no major choices to be made). Super yummy and worth the drive out to the south Ballantyne area.

love this place, probably too much. The waffles are amazing just by themselves, but you are doing yourself a real disservice  if you don't get one of their many deluxe waffles. The staff was very friendly and my orders are always accurate and consistently great. Their ice mixed drinks really make their drink selection shine. get the pistachio one, then prepare to hooked for multiple visits.
We felt we were back in Brussels. They were delicious. I want to go back and try some of the other choices on the menu. We will be back.
Needed spot in piedmont row. Stopped in to grab coffee which was excellent. Staff was friendly and it was clean

I really want to love this place, I promise. I keep going with hopes it will be like my first time at the Ballantyne location, or even as good as the small bite I got at the yelp event they were at. But all 3 times I've been to the Southpark location they have served me a cold "reheated" waffle. My chocolate chips don't even melt :( I have yet to go  and see more than one other person there so I'm not quite sure why the extra couple of minutes to make a fresh HOT waffle would be a big deal. I inquired about their process and was told they make them fresh in the morning and reheat them but if I'm going to actually pay for a waffle I want to watch it being made. Otherwise I can reheat my own from the store. 
Also, inconsistency with the hours that they are open. Everything says 9 until you get there to see they changed it to 7?

We live nearby and have been wanting to try the Cast Iron Waffles foe a while. We walked in at 8:30-am on a Monday after a holiday. One other customer there., otherwise empty. The person behind the counter did not acknowledge us, even after we said "good morning" We waited for four-five minutes and walked out as no one seemed interested in helping us. We went across the street to Panera Bread (which was packed) and had a great breakfast experience. Don't know who owns Cast Iron Waffles, but they certainly don't have their eye on the business.

I visited Cast Iron Waffles recently and I have to say that it wasn't exactly what I was expecting.  I thought it was a breakfast place where you could waffles, eggs, bacon, etc.  Instead, it is more like a coffee shop that happens to serve waffles.

With that being said, the waffles are absolutely delicious.  I had a naked one, which obviously has nothing on it, and it was so very tasty.  I also tried the cinnamon roll waffle which was way too good.  To me, the waffles seem more like a dessert than breakfast though.  So, I'm pretty sure I when I go from now on (and I definitely will be going often), it will be when I'm wanting a cup of coffee and have a sweet tooth, rather than a breakfast meal.

Pretty disappointed in Cast Iron Waffles. Part of my disappointment is in myself for choosing this place without knowing much about it. My wife and I were coming to the Southpark area to visit a family member who had recently moved there. I saw this place on Yelp. It looked interesting, and I chose it over some other breakfast places like Flying Biscuit and Original Pancake House. Bad choice. It didn't look promising when we walked in just before noon (they're open til 3 PM) and there were was one other party (two people) in the place. When we saw that the place was essentially just waffles and coffee, we debated whether to walk back across the roundabout and go to Terrace Cafe to get a proper breakfast/brunch. We decided to stay and give it a shot.

I got a maple buttercream bacon waffle, and my wife got a plain waffle with powdered sugar. When I inquired about syrup, I was told "we don't have syrup, our "belgian liege" waffles are sweet enough without them." True enough for my waffle with the buttercream topping, but not so much for my wife's naked waffle. And I'm pretty sure I read other reviews in which other people had gotten syrup for an extra charge. Anyway, whatever. We were in a bit of hurry so we finished our waffles and coffee and left. The girl who served us was the only visible employee during our visit, and she asked half-heartedly "how was everything?" literally as we were walking out the door. 

In fairness, my waffle was pretty good with the bacon and maple buttercream topping. However, their "naked" waffle is not savory or sweet enough (despite what the employee claimed) to stand on its own without syrup or some other topping. The coffee was pretty good also. I would advise anyone thinking about eating here to adjust their expectations... this isn't a breakfast place. If you substitute waffles for doughnuts or other pastries, its essentially a coffee shop. I fully acknowledge that I didn't educate myself enough going in. However, the overall experience was disappointing enough even if I had known more about the place. If you want a coffee specialty drink, it's probably a good spot. But if you're looking for breakfast, there are plenty of better options in the Southpark area.

Okay, really great waffles.. To eat for dessert or if you are just craving for something super sweet.

Place - A small quaint cafe, tucked in the corner, next to George's Brasserie on your left. So make sure to go around the roundabout fountain, and veer to the left and find your parking spot.

Food - Only serves waffles, coffee, tea... No eggs! I had the bacon waffle special. It was cloyingly sweet and was not good  for breakfast, which was what I did. I thought maybe they would serve some eggs. Maybe they will in the future. 

They make their waffles ahead of time, to be efficient. I don't mind. 

Price - It was mediocre. Not bad for a cafe place.

If I were to come back, I would only consider this place for after dinners, or a get together with the girls for some sweet night/day. My rating would really be three and a half stars but if you round it up, it's a four!

These waffles are the BEST!! There is not  a lot of seating so I wouldn't bring a big group here, but it's good for a group of 2-4.  You order at the counter and they bring your food to you.  It has a coffee house feel to it.

Liege waffles are awesome and coffee is good too. I've never had them before and now prefer over the regular waffles.  They are denser but have have a great sugary, crisp crust and sugar pieces inside. The place is small cafe style so not great to go to for a family breakfast out, but you can get it to go or get frozen waffles for home. I definitely recommend this place, we go quite often since we live so close by.

Liege waffles - thank God for Belgium!  These sinful waffles are so good and if you pour the warm maple butter over It?  Hold on, I had to regain my composure, but you add that maple butter, omg!!  
We had the naked and the slowberry waffles (5/5) and, the crispness of the waffle caused by the pearls of sugar embedded in the dough, I got one word for ya: DAMMNN!! 
Not a big operation but the service is good and folks were friendly (5/5).
The restaurant itself is small but comfortable and the ambiance is nice (5/5).
Google Liege for businesses near you or buy a ticket and fly to Charlotte and get you some!!

Waffles are very tasty, Coffee is Good.  However who ever rated this with 1 $ is nuts.  Place is pricey.  My wife and i each had 1 cup of coffee and 1 waffle a piece and it was nearly $20.   I'll def go back, but not as often as I'd like, Wheaties are way cheaper.

We had driven past Cast Iron Waffles many times but had never stopped. Today we decided to see what it was all about and boy are we glad we did. 

The waffles were great (try the Deluxe Waffle) but more importantly the owners and staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make us feel right at home. 

Great locally owned business - We'll be back!!!

The place is small and cute, lots of locals. Kids enjoyed hot chocolate, waffles were delicious! We tried seasonal pumpkin cream waffle, Nutella waffle and peanut butter waffle. All three were good, maybe pumpkin was the least flavorful and really did not taste like pumpkin to me. But all in all it was great and we will be back.
Delicious and original waffles, quaint and funky.

Holy Waffle Gods! This is not your grandmas waffle iron, local IHOP , pancake house Waffle House waffle. They are thick, rich, sweet and not for the faint of heart. The feels I'm having eating this gloriousness! This is soooooooo worth the holiday traffic hell to get here. I don't think I want another regular style Belgian waffle. The sweetness and the brioche thickness texture are just amazeballs. I'm so hooked! This will be my cheat day spot for a while.

I've been going to Cast Iron Waffles, at both locations, for a few years. I was happy to see that this location had reopened
But...

The change in the way an iced mocha is made will make me stop coming here. They used to be made with their cold pressed Toddy, and now apparently they make their mochas just like EVERY OTHER coffee place in the world.

Boring.

You can only get one ounce of toddy if you get a 20 ounce mocha and they still cram espresso into it. Talk about missing the point.

Talk about a waste of $4. 

I would normally rave about the waffles, but I am not too disappointed to bother.

Waffle was decent, but that the only option on the menu. Coffee is about average. Place was basically empty on a Saturday morning, a testament in and of itself. My issue was the service was terrible. Preferred to talk about their social lives then explain to customers what's on the menu & poured the wrong coffee (Hot not Iced). Not Into the whole customer service thing... Then ask for an optional tip.
Literally the best waffle I've ever had. And it was really well priced. I've been thinking about it since I ate it. I can't wait to go back.

Had an opportunity to sample one of these delectable bites of waffley goodness and I must say---- Best Waffle EVER!!!!  They are not your normal batter waffles.  This is "brioche dough" ....I think :)   Anyway, best thing I have ever had for a breakfast sweet treat!!!  I can't WAIT for them to open in the Piedmont Town Center......YAY!!!!  I will be a regular!

Delicous waffles and coffee. Easy going location with casual benches outside so my friend and I could chat uninterrupted. They brought our waffles to us and the waffles themselves were topped with a generous amount of whipped cream and yummy combinations of flavors.

Last year my husband and I stayed at an inn over a little waffle restaurant in Savannah. They made authentic Belgium liege waffles and they were amazing. You could experience the slightly crisp exterior and fluffy interior even with an abundance of toppings. That being said, the waffles we had today at Cast Iron Waffles were nothing like those delicious beauties. 

There were 2 other patrons in the restaurant when we arrived. After waiting at the counter for about 5 minutes we were helped. There were 2 people working but only one out front, so we waited while she prepared waffles and coffee. It would have made more sense for her to take our order so we could sit and then start making all the food. 

The waffles we received were not good at all. Nothing like those amazing waffles we had in Savannah. These were super dense, chewy and tasted like raw dough inside. There was no crunchy exterior. None of us finished our waffles.

Visited Cast Iron Waffles for the first time.  The staff was friendly and it was a cozy place to grab a great coffee.  The waffles were tasty as my husband and I had the Naked Waffle and we added the powdered sugar for a nice sweet taste.  We also had a mocha latte which was a winner with me as they used Ghiradelli Chocolate with a fresh strong espresso.  

The seating at the location wasn't plentiful and we got our meal to go.  There is a small outdoor seating area, however it was raining today so that was not an option.  Overall, it was a nice place to try and we would try their other options as well.

The customer service here is horrible. I have been here 4 times and each time the waitstaff has been sullen and curt. They say no pleasantries but act as if they would rather there be less work and fewer customers.  It is always hot and rather gloomy inside. It is not a happy environment. Will not be back.

The waffles are good and the place itself is adorable. The service, however, is very unfortunate. On my first trip, I came in to pick up a to go order. My waffles weren't ready yet, and after telling me this, the two young women turned their back to me, leaned against the counter, and stared up at the wall-mounted television until the waffle iron let them know my order was ready. 

Don't expect any kind of service after they drop off your order if you're dining in. They use disposable plates and utensils, which are clearly cheap. I have visited several times and have consistently received service you would expect from a bored sorority girl. 

With training and a dedication to making a customer feel welcome, this place could be great. For now, though, not so much.

Extremely rude service. Daughter of owners is extremely rude and gives horrible customer service. Refused to accept coupon for a buy one get one free. Called "mommy" which ended up being daddy (owner) who then cursed me out with several "F" bombs then threatened to call police. Would not recommend at all. Go to a bagel shop. Way better customer service.

Waffles were OK at best.  It was closer to cold than warm.  The person I was with had the peanut butter cup waffle.  The chocolate chips didn't even melt.  Most of the tables were dirty and the place was empty.  I'd be surprised if this restaurant is in business six month from now.  The staff, however, was friendly and helpful.  

(I also had a single shot of espresso - it was sour).  

I won't go back unless I see a number of very positive reviews.

Free wi-fi with a decent speed! Busy on weekends,hard to find a seat.

Amazing corner location just like star bucks and a wonderful neighborhood :)


Got a text message on the second morning of the recent snow storm that they're open.What a relief !!! 

Saw the text message and started walking in the storm towards the coffee shop..it was an adventurous hike...... 



Wondering about the distance:I live next door ;) Haha
My wife loves it here. Employees are very friendly, coffee is ok, and the waffles are basically like desserts. A little too sweet for me but definitely worth a try.

Delicious and unique!  I had the cinnamon roll waffle and my friend had the pumpkin pie waffle.  I am a sweet fiend, so I was in heaven with my choice and probably could've eaten all of hers as well.  While I do understand their Belgian street food concept, I think that adding a few savory options like an egg and cheese or a turkey bacon and cheese would appeal to american customers more, and would attract more business.  I observed several couples come in and leave when they realized there were only sweet options.

Went for quick breakfast solo at 8am.  

Setting - Simple location, somewhat sterile and bordering on warm.  Nice bar seating a window tables.  Tucked in the west corner of Piedmont Row shops.  Parking was easy in the adjacent parking deck.

Food - They have waffles.  The waffles, being pre-made earlier, don't really have that freshness.  The consistency goes slightly chewy.  But dang, the offering are a diabetics worst nightmare.  Maple, bacon, quadruple berry, chocolate everything.  I just wanted a waffle with some fruit, so I went with the berry.  It was kind of a compote, with really think syrup.  My teeth just itched.  And I don't need the dollop of whipped cream to be bigger than the waffle.  
This was dessert, not breakfast.
Coffee was alright.

Service - It was empty, so I got prompt service, and received my food at the counter in about 4 minutes.  I wouldn't go so far as to see the employee was warm or engaging, but hey, they weren't rude.

Price - $7.50 for a waffle the size of my hand and a cup of coffee.  Not outrageous.

I'm glad I went to check it out, but I'll stick to Original Pancake House or Terrace Cafe.

Belgian Liege Waffles.  Wow.  Never had them before, but they were so great that I left with a dozen frozen ones for later!  These waffles are made from a dough, not a batter, and the dough has to be hand pressed into the waffle iron.  So unique.  The Deluxe Waffle with Nutella, Strawberries, Bananas, and Whipped Cream ... is absolutely DIVINE!  Must try one! (or maybe two, three, or four of them!)

There was a line waiting to order, and a wait for first-come-first-served seating.  Trivial.  I'd wait an hour or more for one of these waffles, and stand on the curb outside in the rain to eat it!  This is a seriously good treat!

Can I give this place six stars?

I recently spent a couple of days in Charlotte for work, and once again was able to visit Cast Iron Waffles for some decadent Belgian Liege Waffles.  These are not your Eggos or quick and dirty offerings from Waffle House and the like.  Nope.  These are high pearl sugar content, caramelized pastries made on a very special constant temperature griddle.  They are then topped with various toppings like Nutella, fresh fruit, whipped cream, and so on ... the one topping missing?  Syrup.  But you neither want it, or need it.

So having already developed a jones for these waffles ... I was pleasantly surprised that Cast Iron Waffles now had more than one location!  Yippee!  And one of them was only three miles from my hotel, rather than having to schlep halfway across the city to the wonderful (but remote, for me) original location.

When I visited, the café was spotlessly clean, the staff were pleasant and quick to serve, and not only did I stuff myself there ... I took home a package of 12 frozen waffles for the family!  They love them, too.  Funny stickers on the bag of frozen waffles tell you how to gently heat them for best effect, warn against the crime of using a microwave, and even suggest that it is illegal to use a microwave on these waffles in Belgium.  Funny, but we duly followed the instructions at home, and had a product exactly the same in terms of crispiness ... as we would have received in the store.  I guess these folks really know what they are doing! 

Five thumbs up!

Oh my...this place was just fantastic.  Not sure why, but I was expecting more of a restaurant, but this is more like a coffee shop that happens to serve incredibly good waffles.  Upon the suggestion of the lovely lady up front, I ordered mine just plain, to see what this waffle had to offer on its own merits.  I don't regret it.  It's nothing like a waffle that you're used to.  It's much denser, like cake almost, and has a sweetness on its own such that it doesn't really even require syrup.  

Luckily I had a wife and friend with me, though, who ordered one dressed up with Nutella, so I got to try that one too.  The coffee was fantastic as well, and I look forward to coming back at some point.

Checked them out at the ballantyne location yesterday. Really enjoyed the crispy, butter-less waffle with icing and cinnamon (i forget the name of it). Cappuccino wasnt that bad either. Very small place, four or five tables inside, a few outside. Didnt feel crapmed at all and was pretty cozy. The girl that served me was very pleasant, I will definitely stop in again when I'm working on this side of town.

I went to the Ballantyne location yesterday morning (seperate review for that location). My oldest daughter has been asking me to check it out because she wanted to go their on our date night. The Ballantyne location closes at 4pm, so we decided to go to the Southpark location, which as the website says, closes at 9pm. We show up about 715, see the neon "OPEN" sign turned on, and all the lights inside turned on, but the door is locked. A facially pierced young man opens the door and explains that they are starting to close around 7 now. I explained our situation, disappointed daughter in tow, and he half heartedly apologizes and offers if he can get me anything... I still dont know what that means.. if they are closed, they are closed. We came there to sit down and enjoy some time together. 
So I am posting one star for the lame attitude, for NOT turning off the bright neon open sign (was still on at 8pm when we walked by later) how hard is it to shut off lights? Also for not posting on the web that your hours are changing, that doesnt take too long either, and for disappointing my little girl. That was really a bummer.

The place has no 'personality'.
I am a huge fan of waffles, authentic or not. I used GOOGLE and searched for 'Waffles in Charlotte'. 
Along with other places, the search yielded Cast Iron Waffles. Sounded good, so I gave it a try. 
I called the number listed no less than 7 times, no answer. Silly me, I thought 'Wow they are so busy they cannot answer the phone'. I arrived 40 mins later to an almost vacant but nice looking place that definitely had a 'coffeehouse' feel. 
The staff did not acknowledge me or my friend. We stood at the door a few moments before we realized the staff was not going to say Hello or offer to help. 
We walked over to the counter and ordered flavored coffee and plain waffle for me. Bacon topped waffle and medium coffee for my friend. Reasonably priced. 
A few minutes later I looked in horror when the waitress brought our order over in flimsy paper thin plates with cheap/flimsy plastic ware. The presentation was awful! My flavored coffee served in a run-of-the-mill styrofoam (not coffee mug) cup was decent. The waffles?? THESE CANNOT BE AUTHENTIC BELGIAN WAFFLES! You would do better to go to the local IHOP for waffles. The waffle was lukewarm, dry, and albeit very sweet, taste as though it was pre-made. The bacon was artificial bacon bits at best, or a a bacon-like product. 
I mentioned to the waitress that I called numerous times. She said she did not know the phone number but would have someone check the line. She later told me to look at the door and that is where I could find the number.
I would not recommend this place for waffles. Coffee? Only if you are in the area and not particular about coffee etiquette.

Kesha (sp) has the best service and she's new. Or newer.  Don't forget to get a frequent/LOYALTY punch card.

The smells are nice as you go through the mall. 

A sample is what sold me. I figured this was more like the traditional Sunday Brunch waffle type and never cared for such outside of brunch so that's why I stayed away. However, the sample had a crunch that told me this is different so I started to research and review the place. 

I learned of the styles and batter mix. I talked to the workers and was told the crunch is a ball of sugar. I'm not the sweet tooth lady but when the mood strikes - I want something and for that, I can recommend Cast Iron. 

I tried the biscotti type yesterday and it may work for others but solidified my top choices would simply be Lumberjack = Bacon & a syrup & the Slow Clobber which inlcudes berries that are sweet and tart to balance the sweetness of the waffle. 

I've read reviews from their original location and people complained it's too sweet. I must say - the kid pointed out how sweet this item is but continued to munch on. I personally didn't notice this waffle to be overly sweet via the sample or the Clobber kind. I look forward to getting the bacon style once it's clear to me if the bacon is freshly prepared or from a pre-packaged purchased item. This won't impact my choice to try it but will either lower or raise my expectations - that's all. 

Also, I saw this from a local CLT list/group: Note to Owner and thought it would be useful to include on certain reviews such as this. So here goes, 
Note to the Owners: 

Hey Y'all, 
I'm glad you all opened this type of cafe and I can see it going over well in places that I have lived and visited. I do want to highlight your manager at the original location (I believe Crystal) was prompt and professional in addressing my gift card request via our phone calls yesterday. Keisha (Pineville) was supremely a great choice in hiring. Although she is new - it would not be known because of her lack of skill or knowledge. Instead, she's poised, knowledgeably confident and represents the company well with service above par. It shows that she likes her job and I must say she is an asset to your team. 

I understand running a small home grown business is hard work and it's like birthing then rearing a baby so I get that when someone rates you with a lower star rating or make light of their experience or speak negatively that it can touch a nerve. I will say, your responses are judged/will be judged harder than anything a reviewer writes. In all honesty, it can be a turn off. So trust your product and team will continue doing things well and for the times they don't then do as you have written and make it a teachable moment to retrain. Just note that you reprimand a reviewer it doesn't always sit well. It's okay to speak your peace but not everyone will see it as intended. In short, you can't please everyone; yet continue to do what you do best and accept everything w/o taking it personal. 

To your continued success and growth!
Ms. Joyce.

I LOVE these waffles and any time we have guests staying with us from out of town, we take them here! We also have a family tradition of eating birthday breakfasts here. 
I REALLY wish they offered almond milk as a milk alternative since I can't have soy (I'd stop in a lot more often) but the waffles alone are worth visiting this cute little cafe!
Although the waffles & coffee items are pretty good, this is not the best place to meet up with friends. They get 1 star for beyond below customer service. Visit date: Dec. 2 2017.

I've been looking forward to trying the new waffle & coffee shop since they opened... finally got around to stopping by this past weekend. Twice! That should tell you I really enjoyed my first visit.

I'm not sure if Cast Iron is more of a coffee shop or a waffle shop. The owner said proudly she thought they were both! I think she may be right. They have a ton of coffee, latte & tea options. Their espresso machine was down during my first visit, but the iced toffee nut latte I had to get was so good, I got another iced latte (creamscicle) during my second visit.

I couldn't control my temptations & got a waffle each time. As other Yelpers recommended, I tried the Lumberjack (with bacon!) on my first visit. But I preferred the Slowberry waffle I got on my second visit. I liked the overall flavor better & I think the waffle was fresher on a Sunday morning.

Having been in the shop now, I can see why they only offer waffles. It's a small space. They don't have room for much else. However, I do wish there were some other food options available. For good coffee from a local place & an occasional calorie splurge on a waffle, I'm happy to have Cast Iron Waffles in Southpark.

Holy Moly ravioli, ok this place doesn't actually sell raviolis but I am sold on the concept. After sampling some AH-MAZING Authentic Belgian waffle at the yelper's rock party at the fillmore tonight, I am completely convinced on the idea of some Cast Iron Waffles. I am telling myself nothing sounds better than a warm cup of creamy espresso with foam and some more of the delicately sweetened waffles.

They make their waffles out of dough, what a great idea. Tastes very fluffy, soft and buttery. The top of the waffles are naturally sweetened with a glaze, paired with their home made maple syrup. Even their maple syrup is very honey tasting with a woody maple flavor, ahhh. 
Does this place have patio seating because if they do, I will be here every weekend for brunch. Bravo!

P.S. I actually looked really hard to find the name of the restaurant, this is how good their waffles tasted. Not to mention the long line waiting to sample their food.

Your "ma and pop" kinda shop- homey warm vibes.. Great service.. Scrumptious treats.. Hidden gem! Parking is small, and seating is limited, but makes it all worth ur while when u take a bite of a Belgium waffle! I like to go easy with the naked waffle, but don't be scared of the Nutella, bacon, or fruitier options. Toffee nut ice coffee is my go to- they also have large tea options and sell their homemade waffle syrup.. Make sure to get some waffles to go- or call em in for pick up :)

Free wi-fi (waffle100) so that's a plus!  The coffee is good & they have several selections/concoctions including Italian Coffee.

The waffles are soooo good!  There are lots of options for creating just the taste you want, but by itself, it's fantastic.

A nice space in Piedmont Row with plenty of tables & plugs! Good connection speed, but if you have any troubles, let them know as they are still trying to figure out their bandwidth needs.

The food was awesome but the service was horrible. The person behind the counter never smile and appeared irritated by my family of four appearance at the restaurant. She never made a recommendation or engaged on anything regarding us trying to make a choice from the very extensive menu. The person who brought our food to us was a bit better as she smiled and asked if there was anything else she could do. At the end there wasn't even a goodbye or a thanks for stopping by---nothing. The waffles were great but I doubt I will be using the coupon I got emailed to me after my purchase. Atmosphere, environment and engagement do matter.

Stopped by today and tried the authentic Belgian Liege Waffles along with a excellent latte. The owner was there and she took the time to tell us about the differences in American waffles and the Belgian Liege waffle. I thought I knew about waffles but I learned a few things today. They were delicious and different from your regular Waffle House style of waffles. We will be returning.

Charlotte's a strange location for some of these things.

It's pretty easy to get to, although some construction around the buildings made parking a little bit of a challenge.  GPS also doesn't really know where this place is, so you'll have to kind of walk to find it.

Really tasty waffles made belgian style, so you won't find heaps of maple syrup, but plenty of other toppings like fruit and nutella to suit your appetite.  Definitely a great place, and I would love to return some day.

This is one of my favorite little places ever! The waffles are so freaking amazing and the coffee is so great. Love the atmosphere of the place! Also I love the waffle Wednesday's with $2 naked waffles & $3 medium lattes.

Went by here today and they are now closed.  The phone number is disconnected.  Too bad.  They are supposed to be opening a new store at Carolina Place mall in June, but this unfortunately does no good for Piedmont Row.

Second time coming here. This place is super unique. The waffles are out of this world and one of a kind for me. They have so many choices and toppings for the waffles. I get the lumberjack which I recommend if you like bacon. It had a coffee house feel and isn't huge which I like. If you are in the area come take a swing by here.

Let me say that I like waffles.  Until somewhat recently - namely when I have to make them for the kids - I really prefer them over pancakes by a wide margin.  While you can pull waffles out of the freezer, it is just so much easier (and tastier) to make pancakes from scratch.  Sure, you can make waffles at home, but they are so messy.  And who has time to go to Waffle House every day?  But I digress.

The waffles at Cast Iron are different from just about any other waffle.  However, to have them, you have to find them, and that is a bit of a challenge.  The address does not help much.  It gets you in the area.  Their directions tell you they are "across from the bank", but in reality, they are in little shop in the base of a townhome (or that is what it looks like) - while all the other businesses are at the other end of the center.  So you are nowhere near where you would think they should be.  Keep that in mind.

Should you actually find the place, you may find yourself disappointed if you go at the wrong time.  While they sell their waffles to go (so you can enjoy them at home later), apparently if you go outside of busy hours, they actually make waffles during this time even for serving at non-busy hours.  So if you are are there at, say, dinner time - a nice, non-busy time where you might want a waffle for a treat - then you are likely to get a previously made, perhaps refrigerated or frozen waffle rather than a freshly prepared one.  Still tasty, but not great.

And there is not a ton of selection - not that that is a bad thing.  Waffles and some toppings (which you can customize).  Everything else is drinks.  Just so long as you are not expecting a version of the Belgium House of Waffles or the Waffle House of Belgium, you should be fine.  This is more the Belgium Kiosk of Waffles.  With beverages.

Wow!! Had an amazing breakfast.  If you like peanut butter cups, you should try the peanut butter cup waffle.   I also tried the lumberjack and it was equally delicious.  It was a little sweet for breakfast but a little desert for breakfast never hurt anyone.  I did have to take it down a couple stars because they did not have free refills on coffee and they ask for gratuity at the register.

Great for breakfast! Really cozy place, everything is super sweet so proceed with caution. Solid four stars. Loved my berries and cream waffle. It was yeasty, chewy, crispy, and sweet. I also got a caramel macchiato that I should've skipped, just added to the sugar stickiness. Boyfriend got the Nutella strawberry and we traded half way thru. Also really good. :)

I was the only one there on a sleepy Thursday afternoon. I had a banana/strawberry/nutella and whipped cream waffle. It was very sweet and filling. I also had a latte which was super hot but good once it cooled down. $8-ish for both; not bad for an afternoon treat. At first, I thought they were located in Birkdale but they are actually across the street next to a Jimmy John's.

Highly recommend cast iron waffles if you've never been. These dense sugary waffles are so sweet and delicious. Not a whole lot of seating so we get ours frozen to go in bulk. Can't tell the difference. The butter syrup combo on the sweet is terrific and you don't need much.
Terrible service. Won't accept their own company's coupons. We had a coupon for buy one get one free waffle, and they refused to accept it and threatened to call the police.
Good little place when you dont want a huge breakfast at terrace cafe. Staff was very personable and polite. Had the berry waffle and caramel latte.

I happened upon this place late last year and, can I just say, what a scrumptious find! 

The owner was super friendly and offered me a taste of their fair-trade coffees. Note the coffee sacks hanging up as decor - this place ONLY serves fair trade and direct trade coffee, and for this I applaud them. They also provide eco-friendly compostable coffee cups to-go.

Those liege waffles brought back fond memories of Belgium and yes, they are rich, and they not so cheap, but just sit back and enjoy it slowly, sip on your coffee to balance out the sweetness, enjoy the chill coffeehouse music playing, take in the unique and cozy atmosphere and revel in the non-chainy, non-impersonal style that is Cast Iron Waffles. 

The place is pricey but this is justified by its fair-trade coffee, quality waffles, independent flair and friendly service. The place is small, so plan ahead, get there early, or just take it to go. 

Bottom line, enjoy it for what it is and go support your local coffee shop! 

May more like-minded shops open up all over Charlotte and give those boring, large, average coffee chains a little competitive kick in the rear. Dare to demand something different :)

Cast Iron Waffles are greater than life. They are slightly crispy and chewy with crunchy little pieces of sugar embedded inside. Of course you could enjoy eating them plain but if you have the option of adding nutella, strawberries, bananas, whipped cream, and powdered sugar on top then obviously you kinda have to. (Just get the Deluxe waffle.) Plus strawberries and bananas are fruit which helps you justify eating 100000 calories in sugar.
Small, but def super filling. The coffee is eh but this is a waffle place after all.

Came here today for the first time, was highly disappointed. The employee and owner (I think) were very rude and not willing to answer any questions that we had about the menu. It's unfortunate for them because the waffles were delicious but because of the attitude we received I hate to say I won't be giving them any more business!

The waffles are like crack! I'm a Nutella and banana  fanatic, and they combined my 2 favorites on one of their to die for waffles. Even their plain waffles come with the butter syrup which is sinful. 

The downside: my last 3 visits their coffee was pretty terrible. Expensive and very watered down. I can't always indulge in waffles, my waistline doesn't approve... So I wish they had better coffee or maybe breakfast sandwiches or something.

Good place for a cup of coffee and waffle. Had the plain waffle with extra maple butter. Excellent!  They use fresh whipped cream. I will definitely be back. Relaxing and good. Many varieties of toppings

Cool place, small yet nice. If you go at the right time you can have a pleasant experience. Staff was nice. Unto the waffles. They are SWEET you almost need nothing other than maybe fresh fruit. I'm sure kids love it but almost too sweet for me to eat if you get the Deluxe Waffle...
Amazing Waffles, I had 1 specialty Pecan waffle. Then had to have a second plain one. It was great by itself. Then I purchase 3 more to take home.
Had a great breakfast sugar-shock on Saturday morning. The atmosphere is mellow and hip, the food and coffee were delish', and the folks behind the counter were SUPER nice.  We'll be back, for sure!
Best waffle I have ever had in my life. Try the deluxe waffle with Nutella, whipped cream, strawberries and banana. Will come back here every time I am in Charlotte!

Walk in it a chain with counter service.  Staff was a cute little girl very sweet.  Menu overhead was waffles and coffee, tea drinks.  You can't get eggs or other things here so if your thinking one can get waffles and other get eggs think again.  It really is waffles and you know waffles.
  Waffles had so much sugar that my husband couldn't finish it.  I should say he's eaten a pound of Godiva  at a time.  They are more like a dessert. Don't do breakfast here unless your fasting Blood sugar is like tanking out and your about to call 911 for a coma. 
   The tea was decent but you have to pay for refills on coffee and tea.(not cool). It wasn't like they were making Chemex coffee for you, just came out a large carafe my husband said it was ok coffee.  Cleanliness was awesome.

Place is pretty legit. Just wish every waffle was made fresh on the spot. They just take some pre-made waffles and warm them up. I got one with Nutella, strawberries and whipped cream. Mocha Latte was good too. Just need to make them fresh and you'd be a 5 star shop!

Menu is pretty limited but the place is small too. So it's not like they can start making a bunch of extra stuff. If you are into crepes, this is a nice, smaller alternative. 

I shall return.

More positives than negatives:

Negative: 

Quite dark inside for mid day, they only have natural light coming from one side. 

No side items to speak of.  Would have rounded out the brunch with some fruit.

Positive:

Dem are good waffles. I tried the peanut butter cup. It wasn't overly topped where you couldn't taste the sweet waffles. Since these are made from dough and not batter, they are sweet and taste great as dessert. My wife enjoyed the Lumberjack, it was a great balance of salty and sweet.... bacon! 

The setup is nice. Hard to balance the decor for a waffle place and an espresso shop. It definitely leans toward waffle place.

I'm not huge on sweets but these waffles were great! For 8 dollars, I got 2 waffles. The lumberjack has maple buttercream and bacon (how could you go wrong with that) and the deluxe has fruit, whipped cream and Nutella. I substituted Nutella with maple butter. Apparently you can substitute ingredients on all the waffles! 

The waffle was so good and not mushy at all! Yelp allows you to take off a dollar on a waffle after checking in so be sure to do that. I will definitely be coming back. :) 

P. S. Their coffee is a little on the expensive side but their service is great!
Nice little place specializing in waffles.  They are very good, but sweet in general and with added toppings, sugar rush!  Would still go back when in the mood for waffles and something sweet.

Authentic Belgium Waffles!  Not really a breakfast spot, more like a dessert spot.  They offer a full coffee bar, but the best is the medium roast coffee. If you get the fruit on the waffle then it balances out the sweetness. The Nutella on it is awesome too!  Small place, not good for big crowds.

I visited this location during the afternoon for a quick snack. Ordered the plain waffle which turned out to be very dry. Nothing Belgian about it. My guess is that the waffle was made in the morning and then sat under a lamp or in a display all day prior to being reheated to serve to suckers who decide on a waffle for an afternoon snack. I have tried the same waffle in the morning at the Blakeney location and trust me it was divine. Suggestion to owner: do not serve pre-made waffles in the afternoon. Just make them fresh. I can wait. Seriously.

Its just WAFFLES, no eggs. I missed the eggs. I ordered the bacon waffle with what I'm assuming was some kind of maple frosting. The waffle was fluffy and had specks of caramelization thoughout, but a little dry. I asked for extra frosting when I placed my order and she seemed a little confused at the request. I guess I baffled her. Anyway, coffee was not bad, considering the shit I've been drinking. Its gotta be the water. Overall, a kitschy little place with four tables. You place your order, get ur own coffee and they bring you the waffle. End of story. I still want those eggs.

This place was ok. The size of the waffle was like a thick bread slice. Nothing special. They gave you paper plates and plastic utensils. We had coffee, a latte and a waffle each, for $20. We probably won't go back. My husband said, he'd rather go to IHOP.

I love this place. They have the best breakfast ever. Everything is so good. I am a sucker for sweets. I could eat here every morning. I am so glad they finally opened a location closer to me. Love Love LOVE!

Great waffles, great coffee! The waffles are thick and hearty and delicious!

Served on plastic, which is a little interesting considering how eco friendly they appear to be.

Try the cinnamon roll waffle! Sweet, but not too sweet!

The staff was very personable and knowledgeable about the products that they carry and the sticky bun waffle was awesome it was so Savory  with pecans and caramel sauce and a topping that cinnamon and sugar
Simple, cozy and delicious. This place is small but the waffles are great and the price cannot be beat.  Loved it here and will be back!

As a culinarian i try to go into food establishments with an open mind. I complain very little since I have understanding of what it takes to create great dishes. I can't say that this place has that at all....

When I think of a cast iron I think of something very hot which should allow whatever it is I'm making to be crispy. A soft delectable doughy waffle with a crisp crust, sounds amazing right!? 

My waffle with bacon and an imitation Cinnabon icing was far from that, in fact it had a stale texture.

The biggest and most dissapointing was after my nine month pregnant ordered a Naked (basic waffle with powdered sugar) we were informed syrup is an additional charge.....wait, What?!

So if you had a peanut butter and jelly sandwich stand, would you charge additional for bread? Owners you need to work on your concept a little better.

So if you like waffles, you'd better get all up in this place... Seriously.  It's absolutely delicious... 

I went with a couple friends to celebrate one of them finishing a triathelon and we had a great time... I ordered the one with maple buttercream and bacon on top... I think it's called the Lumberjack... It was out of this world, but let me tell you something... There is a reason they do not provide extra syrup or butter in this place... You'd probably end up in some sugar induced coma if you added anything to this... I am obsessed with sweets and even I couldn't finish it all in one sitting... 

The set up of the shop is a little Starbucks-ish, but different... We didn't know what to do since we hadn't been there before but we felt our way around... We weren't sure if we were supposed to clear our table since they delivered the food to us, so we went ahead and did that ourselves... No big... The staff were hilarious and I enjoyed interacting with them...  That waffle was a straight up fluffy taste explosion and I loved every minute of it... I guess I'll have to work up my sugar tolerance because I refuse to leave another one unfinished... Maybe I'll just go classic next time... 

OH!  Keep in mind, all they do is waffles... If you want bacon strips, eggs, grits or any other waffle accompaniments, there is none of that here... It's just waffles... Good thing they're frickin fabulous!

The waffles and coffee are so delicious. Wide variety of different ways to get a waffle and even though the size is deceiving they are very filling. Love the ambiance and I am never let down. I will continue to bring people here.

Great real Belgian style waffles. They're so much heartier than usual waffles. I ordered the deluxe with Nutella, strawberries, raspberries, and whipped cream. At first I thought this is way too small but it filled me up. I also has a toasted marshmallow latte which wasn't a marshmallow flavored as I wanted but still good. Great service!

After hearing about amazing coffee I had to try.  Waffles are good, my son had a S'mores one he loved and I had a cinnamon roll one.  I wouldn't say they are amazing, but they are good.  Ordered an iced mocha latte.  I'll admit...I am super super high maintenance about my coffee and I pretty much expect perfection.  The iced mocha fell way short.  It tasted like an iced latte with hardly any ice.  Iced mochas are the perfect balance of espresso, chocolate, milk and ice.  This had very little ice (like 5-6 cubes) and the chocolate was barely noticeable.  As far as an iced latte goes, it was decent, but it was not a good iced mocha. Since the focus of this place is waffles and not coffee though I still gave three stars for the tasty waffles. Probably won't  be back because we don't live very close, but I'm glad we tried it.

I have been to this location twice now for breakfast on the weekends, the last visit being yesterday with my sister and her two lil kids.  Both times I have had the same thing:  waffle with strawberries and whipped cream.  Surprisingly, the waffle dough they use is very tasty, and one waffle is pretty filling.  It is already sweetened, so as I had mine, i think it's perfect just the way it is.

The only complaints I have are:

- The plates and silverware (plastic-ware).  I totally understand it's a small location, but it is VERY hard to cut the waffles on a glossy plastic plate with a flexible plastic knife.  Feel free to stay with the plastic ware, but just upgrade to a better quality to make it easier to eat on.    For this reason, and not the fault of the food, hot chocolate, or service, i have to give it less than 5 stars.

The staff is very friendly (some cute girls too!) , the restaurant definitely feels more like a coffee house, but luckily this one serves pretty delicious food.

I'm not a huge waffle person, but this place is great! I've even purchased some frozen to bring to family in savannah.  They loved them also.  My daughter and I always get the deluxe with strawberries and bananas and mocha lattes. Fabulous! The only flaw is when the place is too crowded to get a parking spot or table. I think perhaps some people don't realize you order first and then grab a table.  If you're in the mood to indulge at breakfast, come here.  You won't regret it!

For the best belgian waffle this place is a must try on your bookmark on yelp!  Belgian waffle is like eating dessert for breakfast so so so good. The dough is made the original way free wifi good good good coffee. If you like this place sign up on there website to receive text messages for good promotion.

They've got delicious waffles here, but the coffee is terrible. Our favorite waffles are the naked without the powdered sugar (already has sugar nuggets within the dough) and the deluxe (Nutella, strawberries, bananas and whip cream). Our kids love their waffles and we sometimes taken frozen ones to go. The bacon waffle is good too if you like the savory and sweet combo.

We've had coffee at both locations (Ballantyne and southpark) and it's TERRIBLE. We've had Americanos, lattes and chai teas...all tasted watered down. They need to invest in some good baristas and better beans. Come for the waffles, but get your coffee from Rush, Not just coffee or even Starbucks!

I was really hoping I would like this place but to be fair I only had  the coffee...... I asked for the coffee extra hot I even gave her the temperature of where I wanted it.  I told her I don't like warm coffee I like very hot coffee...... She said she would make it hot..... when she gave it to me it felt somewhat hot but when I took my first sip I could see that it was not hot at all....it  was not to my liking...... I asked her if there was any way I could make this hotter and she said no not now it's already made!   She did not offer to make me another one at a much hotter temperature as I had requested when I put my order in...... That is very disappointing since I spent $4.40 on coffee that was lukewarm....and I didn't finish it..... I probably will never go back there.....what happened to making the customer happy????.???  Guess not

Following the recent Yelp shindig where Cast Iron gave away samples of their waffles, I came here. The next day. And I brought Mrs. K and K Junior, because there's not much that we love more than wonderful waffles. And wonderful waffles is what we had. I went with mine plain, but the others were ordered with nutella and whipped cream. And let me tell you, these things are plenty sweet all on their own. You really don't have to add anything.

An hour later, the sugar crash hit us all pretty hard. Nap time. But it was SO worth it.

I happened in on the second day of their soft open, so they were still training their cashier and barista which, understandably, slowed things down a bit. With that said this is still a great place to grab coffee on this side of town. I did try their waffles and they are delicious. They were so good you could actually eat one for dessert. 

The owners were actively involved and very friendly, once everyone is trained this place will be a success.

For a Saturday morning breakfast, I can't think of anything better. Soon after this little joint opened, a friend said to me, "You HAVE to try this new waffle place!" But I was on my way just as soon as I heard the word "waffle."

These are not, I repeat, NOT like Waffle House. They're Belgian Liege waffles. super dense, chewy -- they're made with dough instead of batter, and imbedded in the final product are crystallized sugar pearls. 

Your best bet for a top-notch waffle is going at a busy time...you'll have a bit of a wait, but tasting a freshly ironed(?) waffle is worth it. At non-peak hours, expect that you'll be served a waffle that was made a few minutes ago.

They have an old-school coke machine that you put quarters in. It's a bit tricky, so take the advice of the staff and pull it out quick!! ;)

Great spot for breakfast meetings, and they offer free wi-fi. Apparently their coffee is highly regarded by the readers of Creative Loafing. It's not my favorite, but when you need something warm and delicious to wash down your waffle, it's never a bad choice. 

There's a TV at the bar, so you can watch something if you're not keen on conversation. Outdoor seating is a plus, when the weather's nice. I always park in the bank parking lot and walk over. It's easier than parallel parking next to the shop.

Definitely go for the "Extra Sweet" variety with maple butter, sans the powdered sugar. Nothing gets me out of bed on a Saturday morning like the thought of that waffle.

I can't help it. I love Cast Iron Waffles.

Ever since the first moment I walked into the Ballantyne location, my heart has belonged to the perfectly chewy and sweet waffles served here. Very little makes me happier than a simple, naked waffle from CIW.

However, to be fair, they have lots of other delicious toppings and waffle-esque pairings, like a fancy cappuccino or freshly brewed cup of Joe.

This location is nestled in Piedmont Row, a perfect locale for those who spend time in the South Park area, or are wandering by during a day of shopping at the mall. Parking is plentiful, either close by (parallel) or in the deck.

Thankful for this new addition to the burgeoning food scene in SP and hope this store is as successful as the original one. The recipe has, thankfully, stayed the same.

Love this spot. Love the waffles (extra sweet with maple butter). Love the simplicity. 

Don't know how you could come in here and be disappointed in the least. It's a fabulous concept and I am glad this location is open. 

Parking is a breeze in the garage just next door. 

Customer service has always been splendid for us. Could have something to do with the adorable baby we have started taking with us.

I stop in frequently because I work nearby. Their coffee is great and the waffles are also delicious. The place is somewhat small and has a coffeehouse feel. This is my go to spot for coffee when I'm in the area working. Please keep in mind, that these are not the same style of waffle that most people would identify with. They contain Belgian pearl sugar, are very sweet, and of a different consistency than most waffles. I prefer to eat them with nothing on top of them, but I have had peanut butter and sloeberry jam on them. If you go in thinking you're getting a Belgian waffle that you would order from most restaurants, you will probably be disappointed. I have recommended this place to several coworkers that visit from out of town, and they were extremely happy with the service and product.

The staff is always friendly and talkative, and I've never had an experience that I wasn't happy with! Please stop in and check this place out if you're in the area.
Tried this place in a whim with a friend. It was a cute little place and the staff was super friendly. We both tried the berry waffles and absolutely loved them!

DELICIOUS. Wonderful little hidden cafe.   Coffee selections are great and so are waffles.  Portions are on small side. My husband and I could've had 2 orders each and boys usually split but ate a whole. Very good!!!

Went there yesterday with my daughter. The service was great!  Had a brief conversation with the owner - very nice person. As for the waffles I had the Lumberjack and my daughter had the cinnamon roll. My daughter loved hers and mine was pretty good too. I would have preferred it to be a little warmer and softer though. I agree the time it took to prepare was a little long, but I know that is all part of being new and I'm optimistic for them getting better (thus the 4 star rating - giving them room to improve). We will be back soon and knowing my daughter, often too.
I am glad to see them open!! The waffles are awesome the coffee is amazing and the workers are so polite! If you haven't tried the waffles run don't walk now! You won't be disappointed! YUM
The Lumberjack waffle is my fave! Maple buttercream and BACON! Seating is limited, that's the only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars.

These waffles are just delicious. Not too sweet and just crunchy enough. The blended coffee is amazing. If you are a coffee lover, definitely give it a try! Super nice and chill atmosphere. Great for catching up and enjoying your brunch

We love waffles, so heading to this place seemed like a home run....and it definitely was.  The staff was great and the prices are very reasonable. (less than $5 per waffle)  They offer coffee house type drinks and a variety of waffle creations.

We got the Maple and Bacon Waffle, which was phenomenal.  Luckily the portion size is not too large, because we would have eaten it until we had gotten sick. lol.  The waffle was not dry and the maple icing was great.  There was bacon packed into every single groove of the waffle as well.

We will definitely come back here to try more of their delicious waffles, like the chocolate peanut butter one.

Have you ever walked into a restaurant and been turned off by everything before even trying the food? That is exactly the vibe of Cast Iron Waffles. When you walk into the restaurant the two girls behind the counter were extremely annoyed and you can tell by their expression. Then they don't want to answer questions about the menu, then they get annoyed when you asked them for more time to look at the menu, we didn't have a big party only two people. On top of that the girl who was putting the waffles into the oven to re-heat the waffle would be touching and texting on her phone then she goes and touches the waffle without any gloves or tongs and puts the waffle in the over. 
After more careful observation they touch everything with their hands and the entire time we were observing them they never washed their hands ONCE. All three people behind the counter prepared everything with their bare hands, then never used utensils or gloves. 
The food was only decent and it came out cold....even though we saw them heating up the waffles. We also saw them cutting the banana with their hands, then they would touch their hair and touch the food, we were so appalled at how unsanitary this place is. 
On the deluxe waffle they only had banana and strawberries as an option for fruit toppings and we got both banana and strawberries and when the waffle came out it literally has 3 slices of banana on it and 3 THINLY sliced strawberries. 
I honestly don't understand how this place even passed a health grade test. The workers here need a total attitude change, or just a change in jobs because they must hate their lives here.

Man nothing is more delicious than the Belgium waffles and coffee after a night of fun with friends! So I wanted to try these folks. 

I wish I could have this every day but I don't to end of on that Biggest Loser Show!

The only reason for giving them 5 stars was the taste. The food was good and I have to say they are doing their best. They were quite busy so it shows a lot of people agree with me!
Excellent waffles   Small quiet place. Great service. Perfect escape from the fast food breakfast world.

After reading all the reviews on Yelp of how good this place was I felt like I could not leave Charlotte without giving these waffles a try.  They were good, but not the best waffle ever!    

I had a deluxe waffle with my son, by daughter had one with just nutella on it and my husband had a special called the lumberjack which had bacon on it. 


First they need to update their online menu.  It says they have waffle Sundaes and the girl working there said they got rid of that shortly after opening because the company they got their ice cream from lost all their ice cream when their freezers broke.

Wow. This place is amazing.  I went the week that it opened, so service was rather slow.  Im sure they will work the kinks out.  The customer service and food was outstanding.  Ive never been to a Cast Iron Waffles before and I can see why they all get great reviews.  I will definitely be a regular here.

A little hard to find, but the payoff is WORTH IT.  I found myself trying to kill time in the SouthPark area and wanted breakfast so after some yelp searches, decided to seek this place out.  It's located in Piedmont Row, really tucked in to the left of the round-about (if you are coming in from Fairview).

Once I parked in the parking deck, I made my way around to the front, opened the door and was assaulted (in a good way) by the smell of fresh waffles being made.  There was only one other person in the shop, sipping coffee and working at a table.  I was greeted right away and I asked a lot of questions regarding their most popular waffles.  The staffer was more than happy to explain that the waffle base is all the same, it's just the toppings that differ.  Lucky for me, she had just finished making some fresh waffles to I tried the cinnamon roll.  Unfortunately they were out of bacon so my first choice of the "lumberjack" was denied, but I was just as happy when the cinnamon roll and a mocha latte (I worked out that morning so I felt okay about it).

Over all, the shop itself is pretty cozy.  I'd say maybe a handful of tables, I witnessed a lot of people just jumping in to grab coffee before their day started.  I didn't stick around long enough to see if they had wifi, but it's probably safe to assume since someone was sitting there on their work laptop when I came in.

Looks like you can also buy a batch of frozen waffles here (dangerous), but I can totally see that as an option if you A) don't live near south park or B) want a little variety instead of the usual eggos :).

Liege waffles. I'm doing my best to burn that into my mind so I don't forget the name of one of my favorite breakfast finds in a long while. I had them first at Cast Iron Waffles. And boy, what a treat.

Let's talk about this type of waffle. This isn't your standard puffy Belgian that starts crisp but swiftly turns to mush under the weight of maple syrup. These pucks of love are about half the size and two times the weight, sweeter than standard Belgians and dense to bite, made with pearl sugar which caramelizes as the waffle cooks. They're also incredibly tasty.

On Cast Iron itself -- no, you won't find much seating, and my group was lucky to get the last table available for our group of five. It happens, and is a testament to the shop's quality. Can't eat in? Get something to go. Buy a couple frozen and make them yourself. You'll live to see another day if you don't get a seat, though your waffle surely won't.

Our local friend who recommended the place noted he foolhardily ordered two waffles on his first trip to the establishment. While he ate both, he couldn't manage another bite of food the entire day. One is all you need, he said. And repeated himself. To look on these initially, you wouldn't expect his words to ring true. You're not going to find any of the usual breakfast sides on offer at Cast Iron, but frankly, you won't need them.

My berry waffle arrived at the table painfully last of all, as I sat in want watching my friends savor their lovely creations. The fruity concoction atop my liege waffle wasn't your average squeezed-from-a-bottle affair, featuring a mix of multiple berries that gave a sweet and sour twist to every flavor-rich, delicious bite. My friend's banana, strawberry and chocolate combo was the best at the table, but mine was still comparably amazing. The coffees, hot and cold, were also universally praised.

This waffle will make you very full. It will likely shorten your lifespan. It will make you wonder whether Cast Iron offers to wheel you back to your car for a couple bucks extra tip. But it's oh so worth it.

In a town where bottomless mimosas and hour long wait lists reign supreme, this hidden gem was a joy to stumble upon. 

We were up early looking to grab a bite before a panthers game. Our hopes of beating the Sunday morning church crowd to our standby breakfast place were completely destroyed when we found a line out the door and a wait list an hour long. 

We had heard of Cast Iron Waffles, but have never been. Upon walking we found a quiet shop with a cool vibe. If you're looking for a full English breakfast, this place isn't it. But we were able to order immediately, the coffee was about the same as Starbucks from a price standpoint, but roughly 1000 times better. My girl ordered a pumpkin waffle and a chai latte. Picture of the waffle attached. I had every intention of ordering a cinnamon roll waffle and a latte. What came out of my mouth was a cinnamon roll latte. The barista willingly accepted my off the menu challenge. I also scarfed down a cinnamon roll waffle. So much so I forgot to take a photo for you fine folks. 

Long story short if you're looking white table cloths and crab legs: keep looking. If you're looking for a great cup of coffee, a low key atmosphere and an amazing waffle.

Tried it, price is way too high for what you get...a waffle out of a warmer with minimal toppings, paper plates and plastic utensils. Just tasted like an average waffle. could have eaten two or three. Not worth the price at all.  We ended up going to Dunkin Donuts for some more food after eating here.
Cute place to go enjoy some waffles and coffee. They do have acai bowls! Will have to go back for that.

After a few confused turns while walking, I humbled myself to use the directory on Piedmont Row to find this place. It happened to be on the one street I didn't drive down while looking for parking. Go figure. I took my daughter here for her birthday breakfast. She loves waffles, and was very excited looking over the menu. She choose the chocolate chip waffle, I went with the cinnamon sugar and frosted waffle.

As a true waffle novice, I looked around for some syrup to put on the waffle, as I had done all my life with the plain ones I ate at home or at Waffle House. My daughter reminded me that what I was eating was sweet enough, and syrup would be overkill. She was correct. One bite told me that the cinnamon and frosting was all the sweetness I needed. These waffles are very sweet, like Nestle Crunch and a Slurpee for breakfast sweet.

We both are 95% of our waffles, but had to throw in the towel. They were firm around the edge, yet softer in the middle. Much thicker than what you would get at the Waffle House. The shop is cozy, and the server was friendly and warm.
